result.execSummary:
All charges against Leo Merlyn Potter in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leo Merlyn Potter is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leo Merlyn Potter

01:40 PM Defendant Leo Merlyn Potter in court and not in-custody. Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's address confirmed. Court recites charges against defendant and possible penalties.  Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Defendant pleads not guilty. Court accepts the plea of not guilty.   States request on bail: $500 sginature bond with conditions of no violent or abusive contact Jacqueline Hatala.
Court orders $500 sginature bond with conditions of no violent or abusive contact with Jacqueline Hatala.  Status conference scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
